decimals.description:
The number of decimals for this token.
If you issue a token with 2 decimals, then it can be fractioned in per hundreds, i.e. 0.01. To have an integral token you need to consider the decimals. So, one token is a quantity of 100

mintable.description: Set the token mintable, i.e. allow a dynamic supply (potentially inflationary), or define a fixed supply (deflationary)

quantityQNT.description: The total quantity (maximum supply) expressed as integral quantity e.g. the quantity=100 of a token with 2 decimals is expressed as 10000

quantityCirculatingQNT.description: The __circulating__ quantity expressed as integral quantity e.g. the quantity=100 of a token with 2 decimals is expressed as 10000

quantityBurntQNT.description: The __burnt__ quantity expressed as integral quantity e.g. the quantity=100 of a token with 2 decimals is expressed as 10000

numberOfAccounts.description: Total number of accounts owning this token

volumeQNT.description: The traded volume quantity for the given period expressed as integral quantity e.g. the quantity=100 of a token with 2 decimals is expressed as 10000

priceHigh.description: The highest price in Planck volume given period.

priceLow.description: The lowest price in Planck volume given period.

priceOpen.description: The opening (first) price in Planck volume given period.

priceClose.description: The closing (last) price in Planck volume given period.

example.name: TRESTC
example.description: Token issued and controlled by smart contract ID: 8703144722673801264
